body.p: My absence from LondonCD was in Gravesend, 7-15 Apr, to keep “an eye on the little repairs” at Gad’s Hill (To Miss Coutts, 9 Apr; Pilgrim Letters 8, p. 310). He was clearing off accumulated correspondence on his return to London. has prevented my returning an earlier reply to your letter, and sending back your Manuscript with thanks. I can hardly be expected to recognize the necessity of the question propounded at your Debating Society, as I may be reasonably supposed to have settled it very conclusively in my own mind. But it is extremely agreeable and gratifying to me to have so earnest a champion as yourself and to find the generous order of youth expressing itself so well, and with so strong a love of what is good and true.
